That's great - I will keep it in =
mind,.

 

Laurie

Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Door To The Dead


Laurie,

I didn't know you we=
re so close, keep me in mind for your next 
investigation. I'm only in NJ.
=

-Steve H.

re in southeastern PA, right outside Philadelphia.

as when I was four years old.

ed radios to enhance our spirit 
communication sessions. When we get all th=
ree psychics together we 
really get some activity.

did you first learn you could sense things others could not?=
 BTW I'm

ginal Message -----

> 
> I agree, Larry! (and I am a psychic, lol)
> 
> I d=
id not watch the show because my group and I were actually out 
investigati=
ng something last night. As it is we are very busy with 
cases, box researc=
h and other research and projects. We do not, 
therefore, have time to watc=
h other people,often pathetic wanna-be 
famous para-celebs, pretend to be w=
hat we really are.
> 
> 
> 
> I wrote a blog about this whole thing - in th=
is field, thos that 
can do..those that can't sit and watch others pretend =
to do ti on TV.
> 
> 
> 
> Laurie
> -----Original Message-----
> From: "Lar=
ry Weinreich" 
> Sent: Saturday, February 14, 2009 1:35pm
> To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead
> 
> 
> 
> I find mo=
st paranormal shows have become BS and I don't watch any. 
Its all the same=
 "dog and pony" act. Since "Ghost Hunters" has become 
a hit "everyone" wan=
ts their own tv show or radio show. Its all "look 
at me".
> 
> Sorry I'm v=
ery jaded on tv paranormal 
investigators,mediums and evangelists on Sunday=
 mornings. In my book 
they all rank just a bit above lawyers but still bel=
ow pro wrestling.
> 
> (Hows that for an introduction? :) )
> 
> Larry
> 
>=
 
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> 
> From: [mailto:phenom_investiga=
tor@...] John S 
> 
> To: [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com 
> 
> Sent: Saturday, February 14, 2009 9:44 AM
> 
> Subject: [EVP-=
ITC] Door To The Dead
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I have to admit=
 that I thought I had seen the worst 'paranormal' 
show on television alrea=
dy. I was wrong. Door to the Dead has 
exceeded my worst expectations.
> 
>=
 
> 
> Generally, I respect John Oliver's work as a medium. While I have 
n=
o personal experience with him, in the past he has looked and acted 
more g=
enuine than not, the rolling of the eyes put aside for the 
moment.
> 
> 
>=
 
> I do take exception to the characterization of the talking box as 
an E=
dison device. I have documented the history of Edison, ITC and 
EVP [http:/=
/www.sdparanormal.com/EdisonWhitePaper.html] elsewhere. 
This is however th=
e smallest concern I have with this show.
> 
> 
> 
> Prior to wathcing I ha=
d just had a conversation with a respected 
colleague on the West coast reg=
arding interesting phenomena he and 
others are constantly observing in sit=
es with phenomena similar to 
that on Door to the Dead. None of those measu=
rements were made by 
this team. The use of thermal in this situation is no=
t indicated as 
well.
> 
> 
> 
> The real concern is that no attempt was ma=
de to help this family in 
a broader context. The skeptic did and said noth=
ing skeptical as far 
as I could tell. Key questions were not asked (at lea=
st on-camera) 
that would reveal the psycho-dynamics of this family. We kno=
w fairly 
well at this time that PK phenomena is often centered on a focal =

person who can exhibit specific characteristics. That the team seems 
unaw=
are of this is quite disturbing to a person like myself.
> 
> 
> 
> A real =
research opportunity was lost in this case, as was an 
opportunity to educa=
te the public on the right way to approach such 
situations. Continually se=
nding the messages that phenomena is based 
on 'demons' and 'spirits' exclu=
sively does nothing to further the 
position of serious investigators, whic=
h is perhaps most troubling of 
all.
>
